query: Does the WWW2023 conference offer any travel grants for participants?
output: Yes, the WWW2023 conference offers travel grants for participants. The WebSci’23 travel grants provide support up to $1,500 for students, early career scholars and other presenters from underrepresented regions. Additionally, the Zhipu Student Travel Awards are available, providing 10-20 travel awards of up to US$1000 each for students. Both types of grants are based on need and aim to increase the diversity of conference participation.

query: Is there a policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees?
output: Yes, there is a policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees. Both the Web Conference 2023 and the Web Science Conference 2023 adhere to the ACM Code of Ethics and ACM Policy Against Harassment. This policy includes rules against behaviors such as racism, homophobia, and other discriminatory behavior, as well as sexual harassment. Violation of these rules can constitute grounds for actions. Attendees who are involved in or witness any such incident are urged to inform the event organizers.

query: What are the important dates for April 2023
output: The important dates for April 2023 are April 12, April 29, and April 30. The event on April 12 is the Tutorial Online material due. The Standard Registration deadline is on April 29. The Conference starts on April 30.

query: Who are the organizers behind WWW2023 conference?
output: The organizers behind the WWW2023 conference, now known as The Web Conference, are the IW3C2 in collaboration with Local Organizing Committees and Technical Program Committees. As of the 2022 edition, the conference is now managed by a new steering committee within ACM SIGWEB.

query: What is the policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees?
output: The policy for professional conduct or behavior for attendees at the Web Conference 2023 and the Web Science Conference 2023, according to the ACM Code of Ethics and ACM Policy Against Harassment, unacceptable behavior such as sexual harassment and any behavior that discriminates against a group or class of people, like racism or homophobia, will not be tolerated. If attendees are involved in or witness any such incidents, they are asked to inform the event organizers. Any participant who experiences unacceptable behavior may also contact the General Chairs at chairs2023@thewebconf.org.

query: What are the topics that will be covered in the Security, Privacy & Trust Track at WWW2023?
output: The topics that will be covered in the Security, Privacy & Trust Track at WWW2023 include data security and privacy, security in web-based applications and services, transparency, trustworthiness, and accountability, and privacy and privacy-enhancing technologies.

query: How to Apply for the Virtual Participation Award?
output: To apply for the Virtual Participation Award, you need to submit a single PDF file that includes your CV (containing your full name and email address), a short statement explaining your interest in participating in The Web Conference 2023, and evidence of your eligibility, such as a valid student ID, a letter from your supervisor, or a profile page on your university's website. You need to submit these materials through the link https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=webconf23fairaccess. The deadline for applications is April 20, 2023. If you have any questions, you can email thewebconf23fairaccess@easychair.org.

query: what requests are needed for visa letter?
output: To request a visa letter, the following information is needed: 1) your name as it appears on your passport, 2) your current postal mailing address, 3) the name of the conference you are registering for, 4) your registration confirmation number, 5) if you have any papers accepted for the conference, provide the title and indicate whether you are the “sole author” or a “co-author”, and 6) Authors may also need to indicate their paper title. If no paper, speakers can provide the title of their presentation. All requests should be referred to supportletters@acm.org.

query: What details should be included in the 'Tutorial proposals' for the WWW2023 conference?
output:
The 'Tutorial proposals' for the WWW2023 conference should include the following details:

1. Topic and relevance: A description of the tutorial topic, providing a sense of both the scope of the tutorial and depth within the scope. Also, a statement on why the tutorial is important and timely, how it is relevant to the Web Conference, and why the presenters are qualified for a high-quality introduction of the topic.

2. Abstract: 1-2 paragraphs that are suitable for inclusion in the conference registration material.

The proposal should be structured around these elements, demonstrating the timeliness of the topic, its fit with The Web Conference 2023, the coverage of the topic in other tracks of the conference, the capacity of the venue, and the expertise of the presenters.

query: How to apply for the student travel award
output:
To apply for the Zhipu Student Travel Award for the 2023 ACM The Web Conference, you need to prepare and submit several documents as a single PDF file. These documents include:

1. Your CV, which includes your current status, your institution, type of study (whether undergraduate, MS, or PhD), and number of years you've been in your current program.
2. A brief one-page statement that includes your research interest and future research plans, a description of how the grant will help with your research/study plans, how your attendance will increase the diversity in the conference, the total budget for attending The Web Conference, and how the travel award can help close the gap for attending the conference.  
3. A recommendation letter from your advisor. This letter should support your application and confirm you're a student in good standing. It should also describe how you will benefit from attending The Web Conference and explain why you need the travel award. It should also state whether there is other funding available to cover expenses that aren't covered by the travel award.

Once you've prepared these documents, you can submit your application through the following link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=thewebconf2023iwpd. Make sure to select the Student Grant track.
